intro: Dryandra conferta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its narrow, leathery leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. Its flowers are usually arranged in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. Dryandra conferta is a relatively small shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters.
